review: Lettuce be clear, we relish our time at Friday's. We always like to ketchup with our server Christy. She is always open to chew the fat with us. Olive Christy, but ingest she does enjoy a bit of ribbing. You butter believe that we will be going back to Friday's. If you don't enjoy Friday's then you doughnut belong there. And let's taco 'bout something else.. this may sound bananas, but I have found my inner peas at Friday's.

Unconscionably bad wait staff service, and inedible food.   In our recent visit, the waitress never once came over for fifteen full minutes at which time we had to go find the hostess to eek out some service. When she did finally arrive, it took us awhile to realize she wasn't being rude because she was drunk, which it seemed, but because she was Russian or Latvian and barely spoke English. The burger had some kind of awful fake cheese sauce which tasted like vomit. This place needs to be bulldozed.  Don't eat here.  (Or any Friday's.)

TGIFridays in Simi Valley has hands down the worst service I have ever seen. They have been bad with other and now I got a chance to experience it first hand. I will never go to this establishment again. Waitress on the Patel tonight took everybody's drink order but mine and left without even speaking to me. Took 45 minutes for to "remember we had order anything at all. FYI Bree, I'm the one that left a little note, instead of a tip.  Be warned. Don't come here. EVER!!!

Average rating based in my order and hubby's order. He would have given 1/2 rack ribs a 4 I would give Mediterranean Shrimp Naan a 2. Service was fine, nothing spectacular. Server was friendly but not super attentive. Ribs looked really good and were super tasty! Sandwich was meh. Don't expect lots of shrimp and those that were cooked well had charcoal burns on them. Naan was good as was yogurt dip. Offer more selections that don't blow your entire calorie intake in one meal.

It is a shame that there is no way to out down zero stars. The TGI Fridays here in Simi is a joke. Dear God. Save your money, appetite, and patience for some place that has respectful employees and edible food. How dare they call the slop they serve "food". Disgusting. I bet a walrus with no tastebuds would walk out unhappy.

Happy hour food and drinks 3-7. Berry Sangria is bursting with flavor and great to cool you off on a hot day or eve. Nachos satisfy the appetizer craving before the Cajun, Chicken pasta (one of my faves). Great staff and it's nice to be acknowledged for being a loyal patron.

Frequent patron at our local Friday's have ordered the same thing many times lately it has been going down hill at a rapid rate really a disappointment I order the cob salad with grilled salmon just a short time ago it was a nice piece of salmon and typically a nice size salad lately it's been getting smaller and smaller to the point that it's almost a side salad portion and don't try the steak  and lobster it's about the size of a appetizer not a meal nothing like the photo they show you

Walked in and was told it's gonna be a 30 minute wait on the door, meaning they won't even put your name down for 30 minutes! Who does that??? It's 8pm on a Thursday and you can't even put a name down! I've never had someone say that and I've been to hundreds of restaurants. Absolutely ridiculous

Was pleasantly surprised by this place. We came here on a Friday night and I was doubtful/didn't think it would be very good, but it was surprisingly really lively in the bar/outdoor area. We sat in the outdoor area which had tables and a couch/fireplace area right outside the bar.  Our service was REALLY good, our waitress was super sweet and always checking up on us (I forget her name but she had a long, blonde ponytail).  The drinks were bomb, I got a mango berry blended margarita that basically tasted like a really good icee but still had a good amount of alcohol in it. I also had like 3 of the spicy cucumber mojito drinks which were really good too! The appetizers were also really good, we split the appetizer platter, pretzel plate and spinach dip which were all suuuuuper good  I definitely recommend this place to anyone looking to go out local on a Friday night!
Great place for quick meal. Also good location to grab few drinks with friends to watch a game.

Not happy at all with this Restaurant. The Hostess at 2pm today refused service and to be seated because I had a Starbucks Frappuccino in my hand and even though I would not drink from it, they told me I would have to throw it away to serve me. I have been to many a TGI Friday's and brought in drinks and this has never been an issue.  The funny thing is a man worker was going to seat us without any issue. However, it worked good for us because we went to Chili's and had excellent service and an excellent meal and I got to spoil my server with a big fat tip for this Holiday Season.  Apparently this TGI Friday's must pay their servers well to be so petty over an outside drink.

Don't come here because they apparently don't need your business and are doing well off without it. I would give them zero stars if I could. My mother and I walk in for lunch. My mom brings her Starbucks drink in, so it doesn't get wasted or melted in the car. And apparently this place wants to throw a fit about one drink and lost our service. What could have been at least 30-40 in business over a Starbucks drink. I guess we just won't come to tgifridays, especially this one. Absolutely ridiculous.
1 hour 12 minutes and counting for a sandwich and chicken fingers. Do I need to say more? Please do not support this business.

Two stars, two words... Simi Valley. Quality has gone down over the years, or maybe I just wasn't as woke to good tasting food in my high school days. Service was fine and very friendly, but I just get that weird nostalgic vibe here... and not in a good way.
Worst service ever received in chain. They were not able to logistically sit down two families of four in the restaurant. I strongly didn't recommend this restaurant for families.

Time to time I go to Friday after my work they have really bad service at night but somehow it's ok because they are tired but not charge wrong bill on my card and 2 days ago I went over there for lunch I ordered salad but they forgot the chicken after I ask bartender the salad doesn't have chicken he said I already charge you let me check the kitchen so I told him uncharged me then ..... + we have to keep jump up and down to call bartender he was keep playing with bottle  I don't think so I ever go over there again ....  Bad service ----

First time back at this Friday's in many years.  Slow and indifferent service started the downhill slide.  Apparently our server had too many tables, or else just wasn't on her game. We waited to have our drink order taken, then my "Cherry Limeade Freeze" wasn't frozen, and was so cloying sweet that I needed to majorly water it down in order to drink it.  I mentioned this to the server when I asked for the glass of water.  She actually shrugged and said, "Yeah".  What?!  Not, "I'm so sorry, would you care for something else?" There went two stars right there. Sheesh.  We ordered from the 2 for $20 menu.  We all dug into the mozzarella marinara appetizer.  Adored Grandson and I shared the Bruschetta Chicken, which was savory and had great texture. Unfortunately, our entrees took a long time to come out, which meant the dish wasn't very warm, and the chicken was on the chewy side, not that tender. Dear Hubby ordered the Jack Daniels chicken meal, which came with two sides.  The spinach looked like it had dried out and died on the plate, sadly. I truly feel our server's inability to keep our meal moving, and also inability to check in at appropriate times to let us know where we were in the process had a large part in downgrading our experience.  I didn't feel that she was rude, just clueless about how to properly serve guests. We did try their strawberry shortcake dessert.  Meh.  It was a sundae, not a shortcake.  There was one small slice of what looked like Pepperidge Farms butter cake stuck into a pile of ice cream, with a few pitiful strawberries buried under the ice cream.  The conception of that dish needs to be revisited.  It was the least appetizing strawberry shortcake I've ever had, ever. TGIF, I know you can do much, much better than the experience we had tonight.

First time here to this location and food chain. So disappointed in food  Got the clam chowder-watered down and tasteless & Cesar Salad (can't go wrong with that right..? ) lettuce or what ever was in there was sour  "croutons" stale and tasteless  Didn't finish both  Just disappointed  I always give food a try and restaurants a chance but wrong on this food chain and won't be coming back.

Went there with my wife for lunch today.  Our server Georgina gets 5-stars as she was good, honest about her opinion of the cole slaw (she suggested the fries), and told us about the mobile app that gets us free chips and salsa.  My wife had a burger with blue cheese on it (take note other places - there was a good amount of blue cheese on the burger), and I had the French Dip.  Food arrived fast, and was good.  Only complaint was the fries.....ask for them well-done, as they could have cooked a little longer in my opinion.  Overall good place for a work lunch!

When a manager refuses to honor a discount to the party of a disabled patron because they sat in the non discount section only bevause the discount section has no accessibility, this is not a business I care to support.

location: Marina del Rey, Los Angeles, CA
review: The only reason why I am giving a two star rating is because one of the servers came over to say hello and take my order at some point. Sorry T--, but waiting at a bar top for more than 20 minutes when it's not busy is just not something I'd like to come back to.

Went there and had the "smoked stacked burger" . It totally failed to match the description of the menu describing it as 2 burger patties and sausage with coleslaw. It had more coleslaw than meat. Never saw the sausage. I could have gone to Carl's and had a better burger for half the price! My wife had a Cobb salad. It hardly had anything on it! More lettuce and few other ingredients. We have had better Cobb salads at Denny's and Coco's for less money. I issued a complaint to their website and got the usual canned response failing to offer anything in return. We went there with a buy one, get one free coupon if you buy 2 drinks. After tip and tax it was $26. Imagine if we paid full price for this fiasco??!! What a disappointment and waste of time and money.  I will say our server was great, but that's the only thing that was. They lost us as a customer. Poor food and lousy customer relations. We won't be back.

I am under the weather so my girlfriend, daughter, and 2 friends go eat and just get me Food 2 go, I will give it 2 stars because the Food was great, but the service when it came time to pay the bill , and being a 15 year GM myself, hearing that "not even as much as a I'm sorry for the 40 min wait" really irks me so I had to post my concern.  They got there at 645pm, everything was going well and were done and ready to pay the bill by 8:10pm. They asked to split the bill 3 ways "which I know can be confusing at times" so she ended up charging each card Twice along with adding a $30 tip herself on a $77 tab (because they were out of paper supposedly).   It took 35 min fot the manager to fix it, he never came to apologize even and my to go order "is freezing cold" from the 35 min Mess and 5 min drive home. Their 75 min dinner turned into near 2 1/2 hours and just got home at 9:05 pm, 12 yr old daughter was with her and has school early tom mng. "Friday s Mngt Consumer experience is everything nowadays" Thx, N Siple

Happy hour all day on Sunday so our family likes to come here after church sometimes. They just remodeled so the bar area has more room and the patio has a new seating/lounge area. We sat on the patio and although it's winter, we live in Cali so of course, the sun was shining. It was nice to sit outside but there were no umbrellas at all so it made sitting out there for too long a little unpleasant.  If your in the mood for bar type food which is all pretty tasty (specifically the sesame chicken, pretzel sticks, queso dip) at half price during HH and all day Sundays, this is a good place to hang out.

I've probably been here a couple hundred times by now, not including the brief 4 months that I worked here almost 10 years ago.  I think Renee said it best - "I don't expect much and I'm never disappointed." This is TGIF, not a fancy steak house.  I am usually only here for happy hour (though I'm sad they've recently raised their happy hours prices). I still think the half-price appetizers are awesome, and there's a lot of drinks in the $4-$6 range. I don't know if I'd pay full price for anything I've had, but it's a great deal on happy hour. I love the Spinach Florentine Flatbread and the pretzel with beer cheese. $1.50 sliders and basket of fries aren't a bad deal, either. Service is sometimes hit or miss, but I've yet to have anyone totally horrible. Sometimes it takes a while to get food/drinks, but that's because it's 10:30 on a Friday night and it's BUSY. Not the server's fault. Expect slower service on a busy weekend night. I've had a lot of really great servers. The manager seems to care, also. One time the manager approached our table and gave us coupons for free appetizers because we had to wait so long for our drinks..... we hadn't even complained! How nice  :)  Again, it's a chill place to enjoy decent food and drinks at a decent price. Usually, the food, drinks, and service are good.

This TGIF was pretty amazing. I wanted to come with my gf and see what stuff they had to offer. I was excited when I walked in and they mentioned it was happy hour. Had to long of a day and decided to have a few drinks. The waitress was so cool and made sure we had everything. They took a while to sent out the food but when we got it the presentation for the food looked so delicious. I honestly didn't think TGIF was all that but when I visited this one it made me continue to visit.

Went here last Friday night for Happy Hour and dinner. The waiter sat us outside in the blistering heat for over an hour. We had 3 small kids with us and it was miserable. By the time we were moved to inside, the kids were over it. We ordered and it took another 45-50 mins. Within the time we were there, we had 4 different servers and none of them knew what was going on. We won't be returning to this location. Also, the food is bland and wasn't hot at all. It's a shame because between the 4 adults and 3 kids, the waiter(s) could have made an awesome tip out of our $198 bill.

If you live in Simi Valley and want to know where all the hip cool kids hang out on a Saturday night, well I have your answer for you... TGI Friday's!!!!!  This TGI is located in the plaza with the movie theater. Sounds like a full date night to me! Its a pretty normal TGI Friday's. I normally sit at the bar. Drinks are overpriced. Food is overpriced. But it's the only happenin' place in Simi Valley!!!!  The bartenders are awesome! Bathrooms are clean. And lots and lots of parking.

My last review of this place was in 2009 and as we came back, we were extremely surprised of the change! Good food, great drinks, nice decor, excellent vibe and a live Dj! I was impressed!  Their minimalistic decor surpassed that funky 90's look with all that crap on the walls and the flare for the waiters ( an outdated and always uncomfortable look) NOW! they are getting up to par with the restaurant bars of the times!  Well done.

Had dinner last night there.  Ordered the Dragon Fire Chicken.  Chicken with rice and broccoli  This was a good size portion very good.  The appetizer spinach Flat bread was ok.  The waiter saw that my drink diet coke  was running low and brought a new one right a way without me asking.  He was attentive. Overall the service and location was good.  Only thing is the server could  have suggested if we wanted to have any dessert. We were there during happy hour special and think that the happy hour drinks should apply to the entire restaurant not only if you dined in the bar area, as it was full when  we went.

The ribeye and lobster is surprisingly delicious. Steak is hit or miss sometimes. Either too dry or just right. I think in order to get it right, order it medium rare because the chefs tend to overcook it if you get it medium. The lobster is delicious and plump. I get it steamed instead of bbq'd. The mahi mahi is also delicious. The service is always pretty friendly and timely. The spinach dip is great. As well as the ahi tuna jalapeño crisps. One time I was sitting there enjoying my drinks, not really in a rush and the manager came up to me and told me they burnt my dinner so they will be making me a new one and comp-ing my meal. This is my boyfriend and i's go to spot right now. We love it.

Honesty I probably single handedly pay rent for this place. The amount of money I spend here is kind of depressing. First of all all the managers are the coolest people ever. Second of all the bar tenders Trevor, tony, Taylor, Kayla and everyone else take good care of you. Love all you kids. Paul is possibly the most amazing server in Ventura county.

The worst food ever I got the crusted flounder OMG stinky, dry flavorless fish plate I have ever eaten, my daughter got the spaghetti with chicken the chicken was disgusting the pasta mediocre my husband got one of the burgers not good either. Don't waste your money in this place the service was almost as bad as the food after the food was delivered we never saw the server again until the check.

I've been putting off writing a review of this place hoping maybe next time I go it'll get better! I was wrong, I just walked out after the 4th time in a row of being a total disaster! The service is always slow, the servers and bartenders always seem rushed like they're understaffed and my orders ALWAYS come out wrong. Other than the staff usually being pretty nice and apologetic about screwing up, I'd say it can't get worse! It's terrible and I'm giving up, I'll never go back!!!!!

It's TGI... I don't expect much and am never disappointed... the end. Yelp told me my review will be added as a tip because it was short... so here we go... I love their bbq chicken flatbread without cheese and cilantro. Charles, the bartender, is pretty cool.  THE END!
I see a lot of people hating on this spot. I'm not sure why, all the food is made well. They prices are fair and the place is open late. What more could you ask for?
My steak was burnt.  It looked like a charcoal. The waitress said to just scrape the top off.

Alright second time here sense we moved to simi about two months ago.. First time the service sucked the food came out cold and was just all around crappy. Second time here once again service is horrible!!!! Not seems they have children working here and have no concept of respect for working. The management needs to step up and fix this place but will they probably not!! My wife and myself will never be back to this location again!!

Not a bad place. Just be aware that if you are ordering to go, by the time you get out of there your food will already be cold because of the slow service. However, the movie theater is right across the parking lot, which is nice. But other than that it's just the usual popular townie hangout spot, every time I go I notice everyone somewhat knows each other, Staff and Customers.
great staffs. open late. next to movie theatre. sitting outdoor available . great for big crowd. sports bar. American food.

Fridays is a Simi Valley favorite but is real hit or miss. Sometimes the service is amazing and the food is good, other times the service is lacking and the food isn't great. Either way, the happy hour specials are generally good and if you indulge enough there lackluster food and service aren't as much of an issue.

We had a good time out yesterday.  We drank $5 Modelo Micheladas then ordered $10 all you can eat boneless hot wings, bbq chicken pizza bread, pot stickers, cheese sticks, bacon potato wedges all for only $10 per person.

We do an annual girls bike ride every year, and for the past 3 years this has been our starting point.  We go to all our stops and see if the establishments would like to donate to our raffle that we do through the night.  Fridays has always just generously given us a stack of "free appetizer" cards to hand out to each of the girls.  This year, the manager was very slight on how many he gave, which wasn't gonna cover the amount of girls, along with an attitude.  We got there last night not only did my table, but another table of ours got serious rude attitude from the same waitress.  Without getting into detail, we spend alot of money in this establishment, in drinks and added food on this night, for more than 20 + people, and to get the attitude we received was uncalled for.  We will not plan on making this our starting point next year.  I know other restaurant owners nearby that will more than happily welcome our patronage.  Sorry FRIDAY'S,  you lose!

I came in for dinner. I brought a Jamba Juice with me. The manager actually asked me to leave because she couldn't allow me to have an outside drink with me. How ridiculous is that? I used to come here all the time. Guess I won't be anymore. Very disappointing.

WoW.. today was a interesting night. My brothers bday is today so we thought we could roll to TGIF for dinner. Holy shit. 1hr 10min for drinks n a punk salad. All we ordered was apatizers. .didn't even get that smh.. ask for a manager. Waited another 10 -15min and no manager. (Roxy ) You guys suck tonight .it's a weds. You guys should hire new kids to help out.seriously, disappointed in you guys. Well try again next time. If not. I'll drive yo the porter ranch one for dinner next time cause your Customer service and wait time Sucks!! It's poor!! I wish I could do a half star.. ha-

Dropped in for lunch with 18 others. Was a work luncheon  They did great seating us quickly.  Very organized to get drinks and orders.  Brought everything out to us quickly and the food was hot.  I ordered lunch portion of pot stickers and potato skins.  The pot stickers were great. The potato skins weren't worth it. It was mostly skin and the bacon was under cooked.  They split our check with out a problem.

My parents went there today around 2 p.m had to wait to get seated took forever for their waitress to take their order and when the food came it was awful we will not be going back had the same problems a year ago i guess nothing has changed it would be better if they just closed.

The food at Fridays isn't bad; the service at Fridays is bad.  Recently my wife and I went to Fridays during a week day.  We had to ask for our drinks three times before we got them.  Also it took 20 to 30 minutes for our server to take our order. Then it took over an hour for us to get our food.  So for me, Fridays is a NO GO!

The worst experience  ever at this restaurant this evening . It started off with not being seated for nearly 40 minutes after our reservation time. At which point when we finally did get seated we waited nearly another 20 minutes to have our food order taken when are original waitress went on break a another waiter took over I accidentally spilled a tray of drinks on my friend. Which would have been overlooked if the service was good he apologized and handled it in a professional manner however when the original Raiders came back on she verbally insulted him in conversation with a couple of people at our table which I thought was very unprofessional of her. The manager never came to the table to the very end of the stay when I told him they did not tend to our table in a proper manner nobody cleared off the old drink cups or the dishes when we were done he apologized but never sent anyone over to clear the table so basically we sat there with all of our dirty dishes and extra drink cups throughout the whole time normally we can Overlook these sort of things if the restaurant is super busy but it wasn't the service at this restaurant is horrible this isn't the first time this sort of thing happens you need to really tighten up on your crew and teach them the ins and out of being a server. you clear the table as often as needed. But just so you know the food was amazing my compliments to the chefs. we will not be coming back though
Don't waste you time people. This TGIF has gone down hill fast, maybe needs new management or Jesus

We came to tgi Fridays in Simi Valley on a weekend afternoon after running a bunch of errands. We were in the mood for a cold beer, good appetizer, and a tasty dinner.  We first ordered a beer each and the nachos grande. They were very good!! Two kinds of cheese, grilled chicken, jalapeños, pico de gallo, and sour cream and guacamole on the side. Yum!!  My fiancé got a build your own burger and they forgot 1 of his 2 toppings. Then it took forever to get ahold of our waitress to ask her for it.  Want another beer? Forget it, you're never going to able to flag someone down. I ordered the sizzling chicken & spinach. It sounded great on the menu! Miso glazed grilled chicken served with spinach, kale, red onions, and mushrooms and a side cold salad of tomatoes, basil, and fresh mozzarella. The dish arrived and I was very disappointed. Tiny, dry, teriyaki chosen breast with over-steamed spinach, 3 tiny slices of mushroom, and a couple slivers of red onion. Missing the kale and the entire entree didn't even cover 1/3 of the sizzling plate. (Check photo) The cold side tomato mozzarella salad dish was on the sizzling plate. I don't think I'll be coming back here......

I did not have a pleasant experience here. Each time I come here is just terrible. The first time I came, the service was extremely slow and didn't get our appetizers until almost one hour later. Then they tell me that the item I ordered was not available... only after another 25 min of waiting did they bring this up to me.  The second time I came here was just a few nights ago. We came for dinner and we sat in the booth by the bar area. Inside was just sticky, messy, and filthy. Not a single person came by to check up on us or ask for our drinks and order. We waited a very, very long time...so, we finally decided to just get up and leave. On the way out to the door, one of the waiters just standing there says "bye! thanks for coming!"  which was so comical and ironic because we didn't get served at all. So that's basically my overall experience at this location.

On February 7th going on 8th I came at midnight for my friends 21st birthday and we all had a blast. Last week I also came for my own 21st at midnight and drank my full! But tonight, June 13th going on 14 for my other friend Toni, they refused to serve her.. completely. Don't get me wrong, I'm not mad at the server, it's how the manager treated us from the moment we walked in. He was cold, short, and Rude. As well as, kept reminding us of their closing time.  I'm frustrated with their inconsistency to serve alcohol at midnight. It is still the day of at midnight. Is it not the next day? Because if it isn't, TGIFRIDAY's should make this clear to the world before anyone orders. Thanks. Server was awesome.

Worse service, took them 30 min to come to our table to see if we needed another round. One of the waitress came over and said she will be taking care of us then left to another table and she seem to know them in a personal level and never acknowledge us again.

Horrific time management for a Friday at Fridays. Was told 15 min when I put my name in. Then 30 min later told 15 more min. At 50 min waiting time the flustered front of house said "were not seating now, sorry".

My friends and I visit this location often. We enjoy the cheap drinks and bottomless appetizers. Service tends to be a little slow tho, and drinks get pushed out even slower. (which says a lot considering we normally go on week nights).  But the people are nice and the drinks are good.

horrible service. went there a few weeks ago at night , when it was dead. it took 15 - 20 minutes for someone to ask us for drinks. and we ordered , took about another 20 minutes to get our appetizers. never got checked up on , and i had to turn on the kiosk to call them. and it was a new waitress every time , and overall it was just bad service.

Tonight as usual we had terrible service at the TGIF in Simi valley. The waitress was rude  commenting on the choice of our order and only came back to tell us she was going on break. We had to stop a random busboy to take are bill after waiting a half hour for her or anyone to come back to take it. It was a terrible experience but I can only blame myself because I love there pretzel sticks and keep going back. My bad!

Took forever to wait because of how small the place is for a party of 7. Even when we got seated, we literally waited for an hour for our food to arrive. There was a spill and I told a waiter, they put a caution sign and decided to just leave the spill there without cleaning it up. Bad service all together. First and last time attending this TGIF restaurant.

Last night we held a fundraiser for one of the victims of the Las Vegas shooting! A ton of people showed up to show support and Friday's did such an awesome job handling everything with such a huge crowd! Our patio server Alex was so good and so patient even though she was looking after so many people! Thank you so much to the entire staff at Friday's and Roxie who made the night go as smoothly as possible!
Love this place! All the employees are super friendly and helpful. We always have a great time here... the food is great too!

This place is a pit. The food seems like they took their supermarket products and just microwaved them. The prices are ridiculous. The wait staff is nonexistent. If it weren't for the bartenders, you would never even get a drink. Now I remember why I haven't been to a TGI Friday's in a long time, and now I know I never need to go again.

I had gift card so my wife and went for lunch.  Never too impressed with this place. The food is typically just below average but the service can be good. Not today.  It's lunch time so I'm always in a rush. The restaurant was under staffed and we waited by the door just to be seated. I think only one person was handling the tables.  I had some kind of mahi-mahi sandwich. So disappointed. Not only did it lack any flavor, it was a little over-cooked and looked more like a small apetizer. So pathetic.  It took forever to get our bill as well. Not that is was necessarily our servers fault.....management take notice. You need more staff!

Came here for endless appetizers last night with some friends. Service was so slow and our waiter was flirting with his coworkers instead of giving us napkins and water. The menus stayed on the table the whole time and we never got napkins until I asked for them.. another waitress brought the napkins and started doing our waiter's job since he was too busy flirting with his coworkers to take our empty plates and menus. Our waiter then skipped our table and went to the other two tables next to us and asked if they were doing okay. At this point in time we needed more water, napkins, and to put in our next order. Luckily the woman waitress gave us a pitcher of water and took the next two of our orders for the endless apps. As we were waiting for our waiter to take our credit cards, he was behind the bar chatting with a coworker. By this time I was pissed. This waiter was awful and he needs to take his job more seriously. He missed out on a decent tip.

Did the 2 for $20 special. We chose the mozzarella sticks appetizer and the Chicken and Shrimp pasta (+$3) and the Jack Daniel's Chicken and Shrimp (+$5). The service was great on a Monday evening and the food came out quickly. The mozzarella sticks were delicious.  The chicken and shrimp pasta was tasty and full of flavor. It was a perfect portion size  (not too much or too little). We would gladly order this again. The Jack Daniel's Chicken and Shrimp was good.  This choice comes with two sides of your choosing. We got fries (average) and a baked potato (good).  The Jack Daniel's sauce is a sweet sauce. If you like sweeter sauces it goes well with the shrimp and chicken. We would order this again.
The food was great (with a large selection) and the service was good, it's just too popular so there is a wait.

We waited for a table for 40 minutes. They said it would be 20 to 25 minutes. I think they skipped us. Tons of people waiting to be seated and tables open but they didn't seat parties. The server was friendly. My husband and I got our food pretty fast, but my grandson's did not come out with ours. It took another 10 minutes for him to get his. Server was apologetic, at least.  This restaurant has good food so we continue to go there. However,  there is always one little problem or another every time we go.

Have not been into Fridays in quite awhile...definitely a place for pretty tasty bar food.  Our service tonight was great and the food was exactly how I remembered it to be. Nothing too fancy just perfect for going in and watching a football game or two.

Came in to have dinner,Was told 25 min wait.There was a bunch of people waiting.After 20 minutes ,saw people who were waiting leaving.Talked to the people at front and was told the manger instructed not to sit anyone until all she called. WAITED another 20 minutes and was told same thing about manager. After another 20 minutes of waiting with nobody being seated , left the restaurant to find a better place to eat with better service.

So, I have been going to Friday's for years.  I know what I'm getting.  But this might be my last venture.  I was coaxed into meeting some friends for Sunday morning football and there were a few bright spots. The good:   TV's are labeled when you walk in as what games will be on them and you can sit accordingly.  I think that's a great idea and it worked out very well for my friend and I who wanted to watch different games.   They have bottomless mimosas for 10 bucks! The bartenders were awesome and the service was quick and friendly.  I rarely had to ask for a refill and if I did, it was done immediately.  Kudos to the staff on a busy day. The bad: It's Friday's so I know going in that the food is going to be awful.  And since I wasn't expecting anything to be very good, I wasn't disappointed.  But things like bacon looking like the crap you see at the cheapest buffets in Vegas?  C'mon.  Show just a little culinary pride, Friday's.  As usual, everything was over-salted and greasy so just expect it to be bad and you won't be let down. The bottomless mimosas are great but you can't tweak it to your liking.  They make it 60-40 OJ to champagne.  For me, that's WAY too much OJ.  And they will not budge on this.  I get that it keeps you from drinking too much but I find that to be a really crappy practice.  You'll let me modify ANYTHING else but this?  I'll be passing on it in the future. All in all, if you like to watch all the games, this is a great place to go.  If you're looking for good food, this isn't it.  If you like morning mimosas with mostly OJ setting off your acid reflux, this will work out well for you.  For me, I'm done and won't be back...

Food is fine but service is terrible.  We came in (not our 1st visit) at 1:30 on a Tuesday. Place was empty and STILL had to wait on everything.  Our server, Brian, who I've had before is awful.  Didn't give us place settings... at all. I had to ask for napkins for me and my 4 year old. I had to holler across the room to get his attention because he would speed-walk by us and not stop to check in.  I've had him previously and had to ask several times for drink refills for my elderly parents.  Go elsewhere,  or ask to not be seated with Brian.
Don't bother ordering the ribeye for $25. So tough and chewy and not flavorful .I wouldn't give it to my dog. Service was very slow and there are hardly any people in the restaurant
Nice place, however they didn't have a lot of options on the menu. It can be a bit pricy depending on what you get

I know what to expect from this place so I'm never disappointed! I loved it here when the manager justin was around, he ran things like a clock, it's not the same without him. Food is great for what u pay for it, this is not a steakhouse, it's a bar. Appetizers are cheap on happy hour. You can get a couple of beers and an appetizer for about 10$. I love the patio and the new furniture. They have a lot of space heaters outdoors, so it's very comfy even on chilly nights.  I've had a good experience with many servers here, Alex is one of them and she is awesome. Tony the bartender is good people too!  Whether by myself or in a large group, the servers bend over backwards to accommodate. I give them props.

I come to Fridays mostly when I'm just looking for a casual gathering place with a few friends. I always enjoy the food, and their Georgia Peach cocktail is the only alcoholic beverage (at any establishment) that I order for the taste. Mostly low-key, friendly staff. They're not always the most diligent, but they're not overbearing, which is mostly what I care about.  My one bad experience happened the last time i was there, and I admit, i havent been back since, for fear a repeat. Our waitress only ever stopped by our table if she happened to be passing by on her way somewhere else. We felt rushed when ordering, and any questions were usually met with unnecessarily snippy answers. A different waitress delivered our food, and was the only one to notice that we had not yet received any tableware. Our waitress only fully reappeared when she delivered our bill, on which I noticed she had charged me for 2 drinks, one of which I ordered ($8), and the other was a similar, but more expensive drink ($9.50). We waited a long time to be able to flag her back around just so I could ask her to remove the extra charge, and when she finally got the new bill to us, she had removed the drink I actually recieved, and kept the charge for the more expensive one. I didn't want to spend even more time to get the extra $1.50, so we just put cash in the little book and waited for the final reciept and change, which the waitress never brought back. Finally, after our meal was done for quite some time now, and we had obviously just been waiting here, she stopped by just to let us know that her shift was over and she was leaving. I asked her then for the payment reciept, which she tried to tell me she'd already given us, which we all new was BS, because we were never given our change, either. So, as far as I can tell, this girl just assumed that whatever was left over from our cash payment was hers to keep, and never even bothered to bring the reciept, which, frankly, I find just rude and presumptuous. I almost wish now that I had just let her keep the change, rather than leaving her an actual (bigger) tip.  That's my rant. Over all, Fridays is great if you don't want a particularly fancy meal out. Good food, good drinks, and (mostly) good people.
Food was okay. Jack Daniels chicken was more tasty than bourbon chicken. Service was friendly.

Super "meh" experience. I don't come here that often but it's one of the only places in Simi open past 9. I think the last time my boyfriend and I came here it was like 4/5. But tonight was bleh. It's 11 at night and we walked in and had to wait almost 10 minutes for a hostess to stroll by and ask "oh were you waiting to be seated?" like yeah duh?.. From when we were seated and ordering wasn't bad, food didn't take long to get here, but it wasn't super amazing. I ordered the buffalo crispy chicken sandwich, which I've never had. Sandwich was pretty good honesty, but the sauce that was suppose to be included on the side was missing and my boyfriend and I were able to finish our meals before someone came by again haha. We had no utensils and NO NAPKINS the entire time, and no refills on water. super great service thanks a bunch won't be coming back :)

This place needs serious management.   The service is slow and the patio chairs by the fire pit are filthy.  The ground was filthy the table was filthy...  The food was cold.  Drinks are good.  That's about it...

Every time I go to Fridays I ask for Kianna Ruesga.  She is hands down the best server in dat place.  She's the reason I keep coming back.   She's super sweet, super nice, and always makes me feel like I'm her only customer even though I know she's running all over the place getting stuff done.   Ask for her on your next visit!!!

Had dinner here last night,about a 20 minute wait. Not bad for a Saturday night. The food was luke warm. The only issue I had was all the food came all at once. The appetizers and then the main course. The server was very tentative, however didn't offer any desert ,again just put the bill on the table.  Maybe Teach your servers to do more suggestive selling to your guests.
Food was awesome!! I had the Cobb salad, baked potato, and Mac & cheese! Exactly what I needed!! Yum!

Probably the nicest TGI Friday's I have ever been to! We chose to sit outside because it was nice out and the patio area looked so cozy.  It looked as if we were at a lounge :)  We ordered the 2 course meal for 2 people.  Started off with the spinach flatbread.  I expectef it to be pretty warm but upon taking the first bite it seemed as if it was sitting out for quite some time :/  which is a disappointment because it was not very busy at all.  It tasted okay, wouldve been Vetter if they added more diced up tomatoes on top. For the entrees we ordered the dragonfire chicken and cajun chicken shrimp pasta.   Dragonfire chicken:  very filling!  It came with rice, steamed broccoli, chicken with teriyaki sauce and pineapple pico de gallo on top.  It was pretty good but the chicken was a bit on the dry side.  The teriyaki sauce with pineapple pico de gallo was delicious with the rice.  There was a hinge of spice to it which definitely added flavor.  Cajun chicken shrimp pasta:  huge plate! Much bigger thab expected.  It was pretty good, I liked it.  They were not stingy with the pieces of chicken but there was only probably like 4 shrimps in the entire pasta :/  it was not too salty and the alfredo sauce with cajun spice was good.  I would get it again Only downside of sitting outside is all the smokers.  I was overwhlemed with the smell of cigarette smoke while eating.  They should probably designate a smoking section instead to accommodate to their customers.

I took my buddy and a handful of people here for a birthday dinner, as we do quite often. Their baby back ribs are outstanding! Just our luck, we happened to get a "new" waitress...her inexperience showed. It was a "comedy of errors." We decided to have fun and go with the flow after a rough start. The final outcome was really good, though, due to Roxy, the manager on duty, who went above and beyond to make things right. All in all, we had some really good laughs with Roxy as we were leaving the restaurant. She saved the day, and we will be back for ribs in a couple of weeks. (If I had an opening in my company, I would hire her on the spot.)

..........and this is proof they don't give a flying Fuss about customer service: Not one Manager, General Manager, Regional Manager, or anyone associated with this the business has enough interest in the business they work for to respond to a legitimate complaint. The service at the restaurant is poor (look at the Yelp ratings). The service you give in response is even worse.
