Well this is sad, I enjoyed Friday's soooooo much when they first opened in The 70's I pretty much lived there. I lived across the street from one. Not so much any more. As with most chain places they get sold and sold again then new management teams yada, yada. You know the drill. Just enough to say, it's not as good as it was. They even screwed up The Loaded Potato Skins. Sac religious. Next.......

I'm not sure if I could go back to this place ever again. My appetizer came out in 3 min and it was wrong, my drink came out and it was watered down!  The dessert was so bad i had to return it because it was nasty!!!!

location: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: I guess they simply don't care! Time to buy some put options on this company! 3 cups of soup to go, $25!

Typical bar food and drinks. Not the friendliest bartending staff but my boyfriend and I go here for a drink if we're seeing a movie or something. Tones of TV'show in the bar area playing sports for all the sports fans too.

Try to avoid at all costs. That's all I can think of this place now. It took forever just to get our food. Even worse there's a server that keeps walking around coughing everywhere not covering her mouth. The fries you could tell were left over and were ones that were sitting there. They were mushy or stale, and completely gross. Can't believe a place like this got away with something like that..all the food we got tasted like I could've gotten better at Carl's jr right next door. At least Carl's would have made me fresh fries.......the cherry on top though was how expensive everything on their menu was even though it was horrible...never coming here again...

Wow I come here a lot but today after waiting half an hour to open then being the first here be helped first then getting our food an hour later way after a lot of people then getting our food cold a bland disgusting absolutely pist! And they also cut my salmon and my wife's steak in half to check if they were cooked so hers dried out and my friends medium well steak was rare yuk.

I come to this location probably about once a week my fiancés family lives in Simi. It has a low rating but honestly I have a great experience every time I come here. Maybe it's because we sit at the bar and service is almost immediate. But what really gets me is the pricing! Amazing happy hour drinks and always have awesome specials. My fiancé and I are lobster! They have surf and turf specials for 15 dollars and you can add a lobster tail to any dish for just 9 dollars. That's a steal! That's a friggen steal! Definitely recommend going and sit at the bar! The lady bartender/manager is awesome. I don't remember her name but you'll know her when you see her.

Annoyed! We are frequent diners at Friday's. Normally when we have a friend join that's in a wheelchair that he can not get out of and is larger they will allow us to make a reservation. I just called and the hostess just told me they wouldn't make a reservation because all the tables are wheelchair accessible. Anyone who has went there clearly knows ALL tables are NOT wheelchair accessible. They normally put us in the last table close the the bathroom so the wheelchair can roll right in and doesn't block anyone. So instead of making a reservation they lost money for tonight and for the future. I will NOT dine there again. Shame on Fridays!!!!

Nice spot for food and drinks but the service is always so slow here.  I just came in for lunch to find one bartender working his tail off to serve about 20 of us and make drinks for the whole place.  Nice staff but seems to be an internal system problem.  I'd expect them to be a little more set up for a lunch run at noon on a Monday.  Similar experiences during happy hour and dinner times as well.

Place is great, service good. No complaints or problems, the food was great!!! I tried two different types of chicken and both had their own unique flavor! The pricing was exceptional, I highly recommend this place! I wish they had to go boxes for the appetizers though.

I would give them no stars if I could. First time we went, the service was sub-par and took FOREVER!  Thought, "Lets give them a second chance." Worst idea I've had yet. The service was horrible, our waiter never came to check on us and we watched him check on his other tables multiple times, we waited an hour and 15 minutes for our food (it wasn't even busy), then when our food finally did arrive it was so cold to the touch that it wasn't even edible. We returned our food and went elsewhere. We WILL NOT return to this location.

They are not good for a lunch option if you have a time limit. It took an hour each times my husband and I ordered lunch. The first time this happened I ended up not being able to eat lunch because when the food finally arrived my burger was wrong. A manager came over and took food back but when my burger came back out it was the same burger still cold with a cold cheese slice. At that point rather then having a level 10 freak out on him I explained I just rather have the burger taken off the check since I never was going to have time for the issue to be fixed. The following times we have been the food was correct for our order but took an excessive amount of time to arrive.
Had a great meal. Wed is a full slab of ribs for $11.99. A great deal, included two sides. Ribs were tender. Service was good, but there was not a crowd there. I don't know why!

The manager was a guy in his late 20's and I showed him my review of his restaurant on Yelp. I held my phone up for him to read my review that I had taken time to write. He could not be bothered to even read one word, refused to even look at it, asked who the waitress was and said she would be  given recognition. That was it, no gracious thank you, nothing. I believe if they keep this guy as manager they will get many bad reviews. He was too busy having 2 girls on each side of him as though he was a rock star. Hate to tell him this but Rock Stars are good looking and he looses in that dept. I doubt I will be back. He has no professionalism about him at all.

Horrible service.  They brought our food to the wrong table and we can tell because the other table was across from us and we're saying they didn't order this but had already touched it all.  When the waitress realized it she came over and said it will be a while longer and that the other table ordered the same food which was a lie.  Then when we finally got our appetizers 40 min after ordering we tried to place another order and no one would come to our table.  We even had the red light flashing on the table for 10 min signaling we would like help.  Finally someone walks by and we grab her and she made some excuse about not seeing it when I saw her look right at it and turn to another table.  Absolutely the worst service I've ever received and usually I am forgiving as I know things get busy but this was just the staff blatantly not caring.

I thought my friend and I might have simply been overlooked on the patio, but from the other reviews that have been left for this Friday's, I'm thinking it wouldn't really have mattered where we were. Amusingly, a couple of women who had been there before us left as we sat down, scoffing and shaking their heads. I believe their exact words were, "Good luck, we've been waiting a half hour." Yikes.  My friend works in food service, so I took him at his word that it was alright to pop in and ask for a server. We shouldn't have had to do that, but we got the desired response. The time between ordering and receiving our food was actually frighteningly fast; salads don't take much effort, but my friend got the buffalo chicken sandwich. I don't know what to make of that, but I guess it was alright. The rest of the time, our server was scarce to be seen.  I ordered my salad with the vinaigrette and without the extra chipotle-whatever they would have put on it. Fortunately, it lacked the latter, and unfortunately, it also lacked the former. Boo! I don't often find myself up in Simi Valley anyway, so the threat of my not being tempted to come back holds little water, but the manager of this establishment should really take a peek at their Yelp rating. I should have, too!
Pleasant place to eat. I like the service very nice people. Food is really good. I recommend this Restuarant to everybody.
Free water. Big cups. Ice cold on a hot summer night. Lemon without asking. That is classy.
This is the worst place to eat in Simi Valley.  My waitress was to busy texting on her cell phone to ask me about the crappy food she served. WASTE OF MONEY!

The staff here sucks.  They are all rude and short with you.  They can't get a simple order of "salad dressing on the side" right.  One of my friends wanted to ask the waiter a question and was cut off and rudely told, "excuse me I'm talking you will have to wait".  Needless to say no tip was left.  If you are looking for good service and for your order to be right Id go somewhere else.

I was mean to my brother the other day and I felt bad.  So I decided to be nice to him and so I let him choose what he wanted to eat.  What did he choose?   Thai food.  Ha ha I'm so sick of Thai food its coming out of my ears.  So I quickly turned the street and told him to pick a place that was nearby where I had mistakenly turned.  He chose Fridays.   I like what I like.  No bias necessary.  I had a prodigious meal here and I'm not going to apologize for it.  Some people may be prejudice again small town chain restaurants, but you know what? I welcome them for the necessity that it is.   I'm a b**** I'm a lover I'm a child I'm a mother I'm a sinner I'm a saint I do not feel ashamed I'm your hell I'm your dream I'm nothing in between You know, you wouldn't want it any other way And you know what?  I wouldn't want it any other way.  This meal satisfied me in every possible way.  "He saved me in every possible way I could be saved"  (Titanic, old lady)   They're doing this promotion 3 for $20 deal.  Choice of an appetizer or shrimp cocktail, two entrees, and a dessert to share.  My brother got a bacon cheeseburger and I got the Jack Daniel's chicken with sweet potato fries.  We got the shrimp cocktail and for dessert we had red velvet cake.  And after tax and tip it ended up being $26 bucks for 2 people.  That is pretty awesome considering how much food we got. My chicken was kinda awesome.  The sweet potato fries were crispy and delicious.  The red velvet cake surprised be by being rather good.  It was actually really good.  It came a la mode and I asked them to put a candle in it to sing to me because I was a bit depressed and they did.  It was the perfect moistness (eww I hate the word moist) and wasn't dry at all.  Although definitely not as moist as Doughboys, it will do in a stitch.  I'll definitely be back for some more of that RV cake because it was pretty darn good.  Way better than 25 degree's RV cake which sucks btw.   You know what other chain restaurant has good RV cake?  California Pizza Kitchen....betcha didn't know that... :) I'm smart because my momma says so.

I've come here many times and only had one mediocre experience.... For the most part it's great! They treat you like a friend and they have karaoke on Mondays that's fun. Friday's are really busy but it's Friday! Frat for groups and one on one.

This is the second time we came here and after the first time being absolutely terrible food and service - my husband thought that it was probably just our bad luck and that we should give it a second chance. Well.... It was such a disappointment again! We ordered to start a bruschetta and the bread was stale, how can TGIF serve their customers such poor quality food? Bread? Really? You can't serve your customers fresh bread? After complaining to the waitress she brought us out another and the bread was much better - however how can you serve stale bread in the first place? The service was extremely slow and the food quality was so bad that we will never go back and probably never to any other TGIF. The table that sat next to us about 20 minutes later, received their appetizers and dinner before we did. We waited exactly 44 minutes for our appetizers another 30 minutes for our food. Hopefully someone at your corporate office will do something to change this place around because it's gross!!!

This place used to be good. Seems like they fired all their past employees and it's all new people   The service has gone down hill. Had to ask several times for items from our server in the bar. Forgot one of our entrees. Had some stuff floating in our water cup and in a shot we bought. All the manager would do it take off the price of one of the entrees and the shot.

I was truly thanking God it was Friday, as I met some friends here after work.  I walked in the door, and the after the "I'm meeting friends" conversation with the hostess, I went to the bar area to begin my search. After running into some co-workers by the bar, one of the friends I was meeting called me from the big high-walled booth.  The waitress came over as I was sitting down, and I had an iced tea shortly after I ordered it.  She was good about keeping it full too. Good job waitress.        Before too long our other friends showed up, and our server kept up her good service and would stop by frequently. My friends ordered drinks and our waitress had them out fairly quickly.      The six of us chatted, caught up on where our lives were, and began to order Happy Hour half price appetizers. It was indeed Happy. They came out usually a few minutes after we ordered them, and they were all very tasty. Probably ridiculously unhealthy, but tasty nonetheless.       Over the period of the evening, we ordered the following appetizers to split amongst the six people; Loaded Potato Skins, Buffalo Wings, Crispy Green Bean Fries, and the Jack Daniels Sampler, which unfortunately was not half off, but still very good.                The beer flowed cold, the appetizers were delivered hot, and the company was grand. The high walled booth silenced alot of the noise around us. It was a pretty good visit.

Whenever the Hubba and I go out on date night, this is the place where we come for dessert.  We may have gone elsewhere for dinner.....but TGIF by far has the best vanilla bean cheese cake EVAH! Whenever we've come for dinner, it's always been good.  Service is fine.  Atmosphere is good, but loud......what else would expect from a TGIF? We will always come back from the cheesecake!

I've visited this TGI location maybe 10 times over the last 10 years. That doesn't seem like a lot, but not once have I ever had a bad experience here. I see a lot of negative reviews, and I can fortunately say I have never experienced anything like them. The Wife and I came here for Sunday lunch to the nice discovery that all day Sunday is happy hour at the bar AND in the restaurant proper. Half off all appetizers means you can actually get a real lunch for cheap. Wife had the Jack Daniel's oriental chicken plate thing (I apologize I can not remember the name), and a side of fries ($1.50 during happy hour). I had the Jack Daniel's Burger, but upon reflection, I could have gotten the sliders, a side of JD sauce and order of fries, and we probably would have made it out of the restaurant under $15 and no less satisfied. Our waitress was nice and friendly, but didn't seem to know the workings of the TGI Stripes club thing, and after all was said and done, didn't take our stripes number either, despite having talked about it at length. This wasn't something I docked any stars for since I don't plan to come here terribly often, but it's still a weird inconsistency. The food and the drinks were fresh and fast, we had a nice Sunday lunch, and left happy. What more is there to say?

This site needs a 2 1/2 start rating, or 3 out of 6 because this place is very middle of the road. Let's have the pros: They have a lively bar crowd and if that's what you have in mind, you've found it. The drinks are fancy, come in wide variety and are definitely plentiful. Most of the appetizers are pretty tasty, my favorite being the pretzel bread sticks with melted beer cheese (don't judge, just try it). They also serve a nice vanilla bean cheesecake and super sweet strawberry shortcake that is sure to please any sweet tooth. Lastly, the service has always been great. The energetic, young wait staff are always helpful. It also doesn't hurt that this is one of the very few places open late (other than Denny's) in this whole dang town. The cons: The dinners they serve here just aren't worth what you pay. They are on the high end of moderately priced and there just isn't anything great about them. The dishes tend to either be way over seasoned or tasteless. I'm not sure why they bother other than the fact that all that booze streaming out of the bar shouldn't be consumed on an empty stomach. Plus, every time I've tried to order a steak here (which they tout as one of their specialties) it comes out consistently ill prepared. I feel sorry for the waiters because I've had to send them back so often. Most items, be it drinks or food are highly over priced but with the dinners I have to draw the line because they don't make it worth my while in flavor. Lastly, if you're not planning to get drunk the atmosphere Thur, Fri and Sat nights is obnoxious, so choose your timing wisely. Useful info: Typical of other locations in this chain, has private large lot, park away from main building at night to avoid drunk idiots, open until 1am but kitchen may close a bit earlier if business is slow.
They are amazing a man who you can call Antonio gates aka. Trevor is a king and knows how to make a proper drink
Bathroom needs help. My advice make it a stand up room only. It just smelled worse than a HS Locker Room.

OMG i am never going to eat here ever again! Food was terrible. Customer service was so slow. I ordered a steak and requested it to be cooked medium rare. It came out Well down and chalky..it was disgusting and cold. From this experience..i don't think i will ever go back to TGI since there are so many other options out there. Yard House all the way!!! =p

So on a Wednesday me and my girl wanted a nice little date. We chose TGIF, location and parking is ok. Hostess was friendly, got a table quick. Did have a little bit of a wait for a waitress to stop by our table. started with drinks, ordered a bud light on draft. Was flat, when I told the waitress she said she would have the bar tender check and return with another. When she came back she brought a bottle, said the bar tender didn't think any thing was wrong with the draft. ( um ok I guess I was lying lol!l ) my girl ordered a pineapple sangria she enjoyed the drink very much.  Ordered our food skipped appetizers. I ordered Jack Daniels sirloin and ribs combo with fries veggies and a wedge salad. Was really disappointed on the salad was more like a sliver than a wedge and @ almost $5.00 for the salad I was pretty heated. The main course did not disappoint steak came med/rare just how I like it the ribs were fall of the bone veggies and fries good. My girl ordered Jack Daniels chicken and shrimp with sweet potato fries and mac n cheese. All was good, sweet potato fries were a little skimpy.  Did not have any desert all though the whisky cake looked off the chain. Not sure if we will be back. with so many food choices now days and when you spend 100 bucks on 2 people you really want to be satisfied all the way around. Sorry you just can't and I repeat can't have bud light draft and serve it FLAT

My buddy and I decided to catch a late lunch after seeing a movie at the nearby Regal.  It was in the same shopping center as the theater so getting there was not a problem. I don't usually patron TGIF's due to less than average experience but figured it was a good choice for a quick lunch.  We walked in and there was nobody there to greet us.  The podium was all by itself so we casually walked in to the bar area and seated ourselves.  Only then did we attract some attention and menus were brought to us. The waitress that took our drink and food orders was very nice and attentive.  She got our drinks promptly and notified us when to expect our food, which arrived some 15 minutes after ordering.  I had the Buffalo Chicken sandwich with fries.  While the chicken itself was okay, it was soaked in excessive buffalo wing sauce.  Way too much for my taste; it totally overpowered everything in the sandwich including the chicken.  The bread was also soaked with sauce.  I ate what I could after scraping most of the sauce off with my knife.  The fries that came with the sandwich were soggy. Though the food wasn't as pleasing, the service was pretty good.  She didn't miss a beat.

Where do I start... We decided to have a nice steak dinner on the patio and decided to go to Fridays.  What could go wrong?  First the patio is completely full of douchebags shouting and comparing tattoos.  It's very noisy - on a Sunday night no less.  Second the live entertainment was just annoying.  Third, TGI Fridays permits smoking on the patio, so forget about breathing fresh air while dining.  Fourth, both of our steaks were overcooked, thin and tough.  We could barely cut it - much less chew it.  Fifth, I ordered my steak rare and it arrived well done.  Sixth, my steak was supposed to be served with Alfredo sauce.  Instead it arrived with marinara sauce.  Note to the chef - Alfredo is white - marinara is red...  Seventh, the bill for this horrendous dining experience was a whopping $21 per plate!   The bottom line is, if you're a noisy drunken tool who likes smoking while eating, lots of noise, and has money to burn for thin, overcooked steaks with the wrong sauce - then TGI Fridays is definitely for you.  For the rest of us, there are places with much better food & service who charge half as much.

Went there tonight with my friend. She brought me a small bag of chocolates for a retreat I'm going on tomorrow morning for me to enjoy while I am on respite. I accidentally left them on the table. We walk to my car so I can give her something., her jacket. We realize I had left my gift of chocolates on the table. We were gone for less than 5 minutes! My friend returns to retrieve them for me and she finds out the floor staff had opened them and started eating them! My friend spoke to the manager who gave her 2 comps for 2 appetizers. Does that make up for it? I think not. I'm very thankful it wasnt my purse. A person who will steal an egg will steal a chicken.

I apparently am on a TGI Fridays roll this month. We went again this past Sunday to the location in Simi Valley. I ordered hot wings and a cobb salad that I split with my mother in law. My husband ordered chicken fingers.My food was very good and my husbands food looked delicious. he said it was pretty good. I would have to say the food experience at this location was better than at the Porter Ranch location. However, that being said, once we got our food and drinks we pretty much didn't really see our waitress Vanessa too much more after that. It wasn't like we were in dire need of anything, but drinks got low and emptied out, dipping sauces ran out, and the check took quite a while to come out. Overall, everyone enjoyed themselves though. It was a lazy Sunday afternoon so we were in no hurry, but toward the end of our lunch experience everyone was complaining a little bit about the lack of service at the end. Vanessa was, however, very nice and very attentive for the first half of lunch and the food was good.

Great alternative to starving and/or eating the rotting flesh off cadavers in the biology department at USC. I used to work at Friday's in the day when w/w wore buttons, service was as tight as Loni Anderson's face, and the place focused on serving great bar food. The minute they decided to become a less classy O'Charley's was the day the brand died. Service is nothing special, decor is typical chain-quality drudgery, and I'm pretty sure the only reason this place isn't infested with rodents is because the rats would rather dine on feces-filled diapers down at the dump than eat the crap that comes out of TGI's kitchen.  Simi Valley location features plenty of parking and low-flush toilets.

I last reviewed TGI Fridays on 1/13/13 to report really lousy service at the hands of a bartender on duty that same evening. This afternoon 7/31/15, the same two friends walked into the same bar and were treated wonderfully (by a different bartender).  180 degrees from the previous experience. Just thought I'd share.

Worst Customer Service!!! When we arrived we were told it was a 25-30min wait . . . . no problem.  After 30min passed and seeing numerous potential customers walk in and immediately walk out, I went in to check the status of our reservation.  At that time I was told it would be another 45min to an hour since their kitchen was backed up.   The entire time we were waiting during the initial 25-30min not one of the five employees at the reservation counter came out to tell us the wait time had changed and they knew we were waiting outside. One of them even told another employee that I was outside. This could have been handled so much better . . . . they could have informed us the minute the wait time change, they could have offered us something to drink while we waited. But they did nothing.  When I spoke to the manager all he could say was "I'm sorry, I can get you seated now, but you won't get your order for about an hour".   Interestingly, their excuse was that they were hit with a lot of orders because of the Renaissance Faire ending and people coming in to eat, but there were actually a lot of empty tables.  I have been in this restaurant when it was busier and didn't have to wait that long. Poor scheduling on their part for sure!!!!!

Just awful. Service was horrible, got completely cheated on the drinks. Asked for a double shot, but was really a single shot in a larger shot glass. Was still charged for double shot!!! Very, very shady in how they dealt with it. Manager was rude and said we were lying!!! Overpriced and just horrible. Will NEVER be going again!! Beware!!

Last night my husband and I went after work. We were greeted by the hostess who was super friendly and proceeded to go to the bar. The hostess quickly came and gave us our menus and our waiter soon came to take our order. I was very please with our waiter because he was really nice and attentive. As my husband and I proceed to look at the menu the prices seemed way to high which last time I went it wasn't  that pricey. When we got our food the I was pleased with the jack Daniels chicken strip and the Tuscan spinach dip. When I looked over at my buffalo wings I was disappointed  cuz not all my wings had sauce. It just lacked presentation. Since I was super hungry I just kinda said whatever and proceeded to eat. We later ordered the Tennessee whiskey cake and we asked for our check..when we look at it we were shocked that all of what we ordered was a little over 60 bucks and including tip left our bill at 70 dollars... Over all we just feel they should have more presentation with their plates and maybe not be so pricey but our experience was great and very relaxing.

Honestly, I cannot fathom why this place is always so busy. I live up the street and come by once or twice a year to see if it's gotten any better since it's so convenient. Nope...it's still ridiculously bad. Cold food that tastes straight out of the box.  Despite very sweet servers that always re-heat my food and bring me clean glasses and silverware, I think I've finally learned my lesson this time.  No more TGIF for me.

I come to this place a few times every month. I love the delicious Pot Stickers and Jack Daniel's Sesame Chicken strips appetizers. I'm surprised that other people have complaints about the steaks that they have received, I get the Top Sirloin quite often and it has been cooked Medium Rare, how I like it, and tasted good on all but one occasion. The service is what is hit or miss, sometimes the staff are very attentive, other times you have to go and find them to pay your bill. They have delicious drinks, and many drink specials. All day Sunday is happy hour, both in the bar and the restaurant.

I came here with my mom and brother on a Wednesday at lunch time. We were seated right away but we sat there for 20 minutes without anyone coming by to take our order. The restaurant was completely empty so it made no sense to me why we were ignored for so long. The hostess that seated us walked by a couple times and we made eye contact each time and still no one came to take our order. In hindsight maybe I should've asked what was taking so long but I was too annoyed and left the restaurant. One star.

I have to say, as a regular here, they are great, but tonight, we came in as a party of 31, 12 children and 19 adults... For my grandson's 8th birthday. Our Waitress Kianna Ruesga, was so wonderful, she handle us like a pro...  She dealt with everything that we gave her, mind you 4 of the people there were waitresses and can't believe she pulled it off. Kianna, definitely knows her job, and went beyond being just a server. Next time I come in I will be asking for her station...
It's close to home and easy. The drinks don't have as much alcohol as other places, if any! The food is decent.   Nothing special at all.

I am only giving one star because there is no zero. I must preface this with the food was quite delicious but I asked for the gluten sensitive Version of my burger and when it came out it seemed too good to be true. I asked the waitress if this was a gluten-free bun she told me it was with a smile. it is 12 hours later and I am so sick because it was not. If you have celiac or gluten intolerance eat here at your own risk. The staff definitely needs better training. This is not to say that they were not courteous and friendly. The atmosphere was great. If it hadn't been for my food makes up I'd be giving them a five.

I usually come here and enjoy the food and drinks, and have a good time. But today was the worst experience I've ever had in any restaurant. So the waitress comes and we order our drinks. They come quick. My friends orders his food, I let the waitress know I needed more time deciding what to order. So some guy brings my friend his order and we get two more beers. That was it. Not one waiter or waitress returned to see if we needed anything. I DIDN'T EVEN GET TO ORDER. 20-25 minutes pass by and we had to get up and find someone to pay the bill. Ridiculous.

My fiancé and I recently moved to Simi and so far this seems like the place to go for a decent Happy Hour. We have been here a handful of times during the day, food was always good but the service has been so-so. But this past Saturday was the first time we went after 10 and the 1/2 off appetizers were a nice surprise, the mozzarella sticks were sooooooo good, perfectly melty and crunchy. The lemon drop and chocolate martini (which I know is a pain to make) were great, delicious and I could taste the vodka. The drinks somewhat makes up for the fact that the bartender that night did not seem very friendly. He was attentive enough but 'just' enough to keep me happy. Overall I would have given it a 4 if the bartender had been a bit more welcoming but we will definitely be back for future Happy Hours.

I've been in Simi for just over a year.  I've tried to eat here 4 times. I was successful once and that is because I was waiting to meet a friend and she was hungry when she finally arrived so I endured the lackluster service.  On the other occasions I just left.  No one seemed concerned about serving us in an establishment that was neither crowded or busy. On all 3 occasions after waiting from 5 to 10 minutes without being served the hubs and I left.  Will never go back. NOT EVER!
Great food I been to happy hour twice good drinks good food try the buffalo wings spinach dip was so good and bad Mac n cheese bacon balls so delish will continue to go with my friends for happy hour

We recently spent the evening at Friday's for a fundraiser. This is something we do almost monthly at various establishments that are kind enough to offer to host. We generally draw a fantastic turnout. The latest one was no different. Unfortunately, the restaurant was unprepared. We sat in the bar area for the happy hour menu. My wife and I spend a lot of time volunteering, so we wanted to enjoy the evening with reasonably priced beers and appetizers accompanied by our close friends. We got there about 5:30 on a Tuesday with the bar area about half full. There was on server assigned to the bar. Apparently, the restaurant thought one server in the bar area was sufficient and, quickly, the bar was packed.  I'm just going to break down the night into different aspects of the experience rather than writing out the three hour experience. The service: Our first round of drinks came with light heady pours. It is what it is. A bad pour is based on the bartender, but it's always a little disappointing. We moved on. With one server in the bar area though, we had a lot of down time where he didn't come to see us. Multiple times we had to stop him to ask to order food or drinks and usually that was met with an impatient sigh if not downright rude comments. When new people joined us, he never came to take their order. When we ordered food, it took up to an hour to receive it. Our friends ordered the potato skins appetizer. It took an hour to come and when it did, the plate was hot to the touch from sitting under the heat lamp so long. Inconsistent pours, delays in both ordering and receiving what we wanted, and his surliness left a bad impression. By the end of the night, the manager had to personally bring us items we'd ordered because the server had either never put them in or forgotten to bring them out. He even had to clear our beer glasses after I had started stacking them in the center of the table to make room for food that never came. The Bill: After our first round the server asked if we were all on one bill, we replied no and told him who ordered what so he could start separate bills. While he wrote something down, he apparently never actually separated the bills. At the end of the night, we received one bill and he explained that with everyone ordering, he just couldn't keep track. Incompetence is not an excuse. We were all reasonable and would have given him the time necessary to track tabs or even split the bill ourselves at the end of the night if he had been upgront with us and said he couldn't manage splitting it with such a large group.  The end of the night, though, came long after we were ready to leave. It took an hour to get our bill. When we did get it, there were countless items that were wrong. I had to send back the bill three times because items we didn't order were on the bill and prices were wrong. The appetizers that took 45 minutes to come out?Oh, that was apparently because he forgot to put them in as evidenced by the non happy hour pricing. The process of actually paying the bill took so long we had to order another round of drinks for the wait. If it wasn't a fundraiser, this would have been the first time I ever left without paying a bill.  The manager: He was very nice, but by the time he tried to intervene, it was too late. He should have been bussing tables and bringing out food earlier. He should have called in a server who had the night off. He should have expected a better turnout from the beginning. He gave us free appetizer coupons and offered to increase staff if we returned, but why would we? It went beyond "lack of staff" to "rude and incompetent staff".  The product: Was fine when it came on time, but why order endless wings if he never asks if you want a refill and never brings them when you order them? Beer levels were wildly inconsistent. Sometimes the glass was full, sometimes the beer stopped two inches from the top. I can't really complain about the quality I guess. It was as expected. Overall, this was a really disappointing night. After three hours, I ended up donating $10 to our organization. Of course, I could have donated that directly and not had to deal with the irritation of our friends who were there to support our organization. Fridays performed so poorly that it reflected bad on our non profit. That's very disappointing.

Unfortunately I have to agree with the negative reviews regarding the service. We came in on a Wednesday around lunch time we were seated immediately (it was practically empty) the waitress took or drink order and came back in less than two minutes so far so good right?. Right it took her twenty minutes to come back and take our order when she finally did it took close to 35 minutes for her to bring it out now am not blaming her for the cook taking his time in making our food but she never even came by to see how we were doing. The one and only time she did she was walking by with someone else's order in her hand and didn't even stop at our table just kinda mumbled it as she walked by.  We both ordered the sizzling chicken and mashed potatoes which was delicious however the bad and slow service was the deal breaker. When it was time to leave and I finally caught her to ask her for the check it took her forever to bring it. When I was ready to pay she never came back so I decided to pay in the tablets thingies they have  on the tables. I probably won't come back to this location and defiantly don't recommend you come in if you are on a lunch break I guarantee you will be late clocking back into work. No tip for her.

Majority of the time my food arrives dry as a board or soggy as a sweaty sock.  We only go when we get coupons and we still have to send food back. They need to fire majority of the kitchen. If they didn't mail bogo cupouns I'm sure they'd lose majority of their customers.

I came here the other night with my boy friend & friend. The service was absolutely terrible, I will not be coming back again. I myself am a server, so I know what it's like. We came in @12:30am. Online it said they were open till 2am, but apparently it was wrong. They actually close @1am but we didn't find that out till we were already there. We decided to stay. Our server (I believe her name was Pj) told us that we had to order fast because the kitchen was closing in 10 minutes. Excuse me? I'm a paying customer... I could come in @12:59am, you have to serve me. She didn't come to check up on us once. She only came to take the order and to drop off the check. She didn't refill our drinks, she didn't see if we needed anything extra, she didn't make sure the food came out okay... Nothing. Also she made us order dessert with our meal because the "kitchen" was closing. Who wants to eat dessert with dinner? I decided to speak to the manager & he was also very rude (I'm unsure of his name) he also said the kitchen was closed. I thought he was rude and provided us with bad service. He didn't apologize for the bad service or anything. We finally figured it what our server was doing the whole time. She was too busy in the bar with he friends hanging out..... Long story short, I won't be coming back.

Kyle & the bartender made my boyfriends & my night  karioke I had a blast !!! I'm only off on Mondays & we will be making this our place to chill! The service five star the food yummy I had the hibachi chicken ! Yummy yummy! I will def be back every Monday to sing eat & drink Kyle should be promoted to general manager!!!!

The portions shrink every time I visit.. Few service staff still treat you and your group with respect. Bar Patrons always get left unattended. At one point it took 35 minutes to get just a bottled beer.. I'm pretty sure they left it out for the entire 35 minutes, when the guy handed it to me I could feel it was room temperature and told him to bring me a cold one.. He gets this look in his eye like I'm an a-hole for wanting a cold beer.  Buddy if you are paying out of bum for a beer it better at least be cold. Happy Hour prices are the only reason a very few of my friends will still come here.

Only gave a (1) star because that's the lowest.  This place is absolutely HORRIBLE!  Management should be embarrassed.  I hope Corporate reads these so they shut this place down.  I travel a lot and I can say most TGIF's have gone way down hill over the years, but this one in Simi is disgusting. The service is pathetic and the food is not meant for human consumption.  They don't make anything fresh.  It's all prepared.  The lettuce is wilted and dirty, the chicken tenders are tiny and taste like rubber (most likely microwaved), the fries are way undercooked, the cheese sticks are thawed out and served at room temperature, the steak is like cardboard.  The service is basically non-existent.  You have to ask for things multiple times and you're lucky if you get place setting within five minutes after getting your meal.  Forget free refills because unless you're there for two hours you're not getting a refill.  The servers make you feel like you did something wrong when you order or when you ask for anything.  Obviously a sign of how unhappy they are with their management.   I don't go to this one much.  In fact, I don't go to any of them much.  But this one is empty every time I walk in.  It's kids eat free on Monday and at 7:30 the restaurant is at about 25% capacity.  At what point do you give up and shut down.  Close this down and let a reputable restaurant come in and serve the community well.

This place has a great happy hour, especially on Sundays. Food and drinks are good priced, lots to choose from, and very tasty. I go here often.    The reason why they don't get 5 stars is for the staff. Every time I am there it is a 2-3 hour ordeal. Their service is soooooooo slow. If you walk in and sit at the bar during happy hour, nobody will come and approach you for a long time, and they act like you're a burden when they finally do show up. It takes forever to get the check and forever to get it back. I come here all the time but I won't come here if I don't have at least 2 hours to spare because that's the minimum time it takes to get in, eat, and get out.   The environment here on a friday night is what you would expect. It is a young adult crowd that can get kind of rowdy and loud. Lots of girls do drugs in the bathroom. Typical friday! They would also get the full 5 stars if they would actually answer my question when I ask what the dang friday's rewards card is, although no one has figured out how to answer that question for me yet.
Used to be a big fan, tonight was over priced and the service was slow. The food came luke warm. Wasn't impressed.

So my bf and I went here to eat and have a drink before our movie. We always sit at the bar now there is no one behind the bar for what felt like 10 mins. So I grab us menus I see on the counter. Finally someone comes out to take our drink order. After that we never  really saw a bartender after. They avoided eye contact with us the entire time. Took forever to take our food order and thats only because my bf had to tell the bartender we were ready.  But as soon as some other lady comes in, she gets immediate service and she even got her her food and bill before us. So i donno if it's me or if your not white u get no help. Swear it was the worst help ever. It's really not that hard to ask. Are you ready to order or do you need anything? Now just so u guys know I'm not normally one to complain about anything ever. For some one to upset me takes a lot. The bartender looked like she hated her life. Look u choose to have that job. At least try and act like u give a funk. And btw when we did get food it tasted burnt. So food and service we're terrible. Oh also I wrote the bartender a little message "No Service, No Tip". Hopefully that will sink in to be nice and do your damn job. A tip is only give when it's deserved.

we were told it would be a 30 minute wait to be seated...OK so we wait 10 and are seated..hmm once seated the waiter comes over and takes our drink order, while we were waiting my wife was checking out the menu online. there was a drink that sounded good, strawberry henny o I order that 10 minutes the waiter comes over and says if I can tell him what's in it they can make it..I'm not a Fridays bartender how do I know what's in it? so I order the ultimate grand margaritas it comes in a regular glass no salted rim tasted like juice and took another 10 minutes to make.finaly he takes our food order my wife ordered the endless appetizers 45 minutes later out comes our food,no time for appetizers refill don't appetizers come before entrees? the tables,ketchup bottle menu's were all sticky the wall by out table had dried up ketchup on it and there slow service made us miss our movie all together and we gave ourselfs an hour and a half. I have been dining in West Hills at the chilies lately when I dine out and the service there is exceptional every time,even when they're training.fridays staff should go there to see how it's done. I won't return.

Happy hour prices are great.  But the drinks are water down.  The menu was stiicky.  The waitress was no where to be found.  Food was alright.  May go back to TGIF for cheap drinks and food; probably not here though.

I stopped by yesterday for a mid-day lunch and found the place almost empty. The food is pretty good. I had one of their signature hamburgers. The service was ok and tentative but that may be because it was so quiet. The physical place is getting a little outdated and the booths need some work. I darn near flipped out of my seat when the cushion popped up.

Our meal hasn't arrived yet, so far the service isn't the best. My daughter spilled her during and the waitress brought us some napkins after about 5 minutes and we had to clean up the mess ourselves. I was a server for 6 years and I have never heard of making the guest clean up a spill on their own. There is still a big puddle under our table, hopefully no one slips and falls. She also forgot my husbands drink. Hopefully the food is good enough to make up for the horrible service.
Didn't think you could mess up happy hour. Beer was warm, chicken wings were cold. However prices were cheap

All I can say is I must have been drunk when I went here single. My lady and I went a few weeks ago. The food just blows. If they got a good deal on the chef or cook, They need to stop paying minimum wage.  Maybe free beers before every meal would make it

TGIFs in general have gone completely downlhill over the years. The last two times we went here, for a drink and app, we ended up walking out. Service sucks. The first time, it was Sunday after a movie- and of course super crowded with football. The tables were dirty & sticky, and the service was so slow. I thought it was because it was crowded until I saw our server chatting it up in the back with other servers. Got tired of waiting and went elsewhere.  Next, went straight to the bar. Took forever to get noticed. I asked for a cocktail or happy hour menu and they couldnt' find one. Again, got tired of waiting as the bartender stood around talking, so we left. The service is awful. Spend your hard-earned money elsewhere.  I'm giving it a two stars because I feel bad giving it a 1.

I am definitely a fan! Last night I went there again and had great service! Even though our bar tender was busy, he still came to the table as often as if it was slow. It is such a great atmosphere for adults to go to after hours when most restaurants are closed. With great beer on tap and awesome happy hour deals, you really can't beat this place! The food is always good, I personally like the jack chicken strips. Very good and half off during happy hour! Cha ching!

We came here on a Saturday night after watching a movie, we were seated before 10pm and had to wait until after 11pm to get our food, it looked like they only had one waitress for taking orders on a pretty busy night.  They only got out food ready after one of my friends complained.  They did give us some money off vouchers but still had to wait hungry for over an hour, not much fun.  Food was usual Fridays stuff, would go somewhere else next time.

We just had a reunion shindig here and the staff was so attentive and helpful! We were on the patio in the evening and it was the perfect ambiance for the reunion. Thanks to Sharene, Roxy, Nikki, and others!!

I see that the T.O. location has more stars than this one.  I prefer this one to T.O.  It's just soooooooooo quiet over at that location.  I like a little more going on than that.  However, I'm just not loving their food.  It's "ok," but the reason I come here is when it's LATE, and I have nowhere else to go.....esp. living in Simi Valley, where 9:00 is already considered late (rolling eyes and sighing).  Really?  Anyway, their caesar salad is really almost below average.  It's not a caesar dressing.  Not that I even know what a TRUE caesar dressing tastes like anymore, but this sure isn't it.  I get their grilled chicken with mashed potatoes.  It's got some flavor, but the chicken can be a little on the dry side, and while the mashed potatoes have a lot of flavor, the texture is a little pasty sometimes.  Anyway, it's good in a pinch, but I don't love it.  Their drinks look great, as do their desserts.....but I never get them, sooooooooooooo they're lost on me.  Thank goodness they're open late.

I WAS gonna give this a two stars out of pity, but after reading all these comments, I figured they don't deserve it. Our server, or of what we saw of him was OK. We rarely saw him. though i was surprised at how fast we were seated with it being so busy. However, The food was not that good.. We went for my best friends birthday and after the 40 minutes after our food arrived, my fries were cold, discolored, dead, and soggy. You could definitely tell they had been sitting there for a while.My best friends meat was dry and over-cooked. their "signature sauce" was gross, and she had to eat her mini steak with A1 sauce, and she HATES A1 sauce..  the wild berry lemonade tasted like it was made purely of sugar and ice.  I wish i had read these reviews BEFORE we tried to have a good time there.

I have been a patron of this Friday's for some time now but everything turned upside down last night.  After a long and tiring week from work me & my friends were ready to relax, eat and drink and we chose to go to this location which later on we regret so much.  We came in at 8pm, had ourselves listed to get a table for four. We are Asians, we are Filipinos and we never thought that this will be a reason for us not to get equal treatment in a well known place like this.  On our 45th minute of wait another group of four white kids came in and in less than 10 minutes the receptionist led them to a table.  We know for a fact that they were not listed because they themselves were even talking about what they need to do to get a table, meaning they don't know they have to be listed first. So my friend went to ask the receptionist that had the waiting list, asking why these people got a table first when we were there ahead of them and that we have been waiting for almost an hour. The receptionist first asked the name we gave them on the list and when we told her she looks at the list and said she has been calling us but we never came. Like really? How can we not mind a call from her when she was less than 5 feet away from us and we were attentive to their calls because, HELLO!! We were already hungry!! I go here almost once a month. I have had a few servers who are bland and uninterested, but for the most part, the servings have been pretty good compared to the T.O. one. I think they changed their recipes a bit, since the bruschetta chicken pasta tasted a little different...almost like there was tomato sauce in it. The menus have been known for being sticky, but they got new ones and the atmosphere is always fun. Hopefully the pasta pasta was a one time thing, I'd hate to let this place go!
Greasy fish and chips but OMG the vanilla bean cheesecake makes up for it. Black bean burger is great. Parmesan chicken is too.
I sat at the bar, enjoyed the megatouch touchscreen game and asked the beautiful server for the 2 for $10 menu. I ordered the bbq chicken flatbread and fried shrimp and enjoyed every last bite.

I was pretty disappointed at the TGIF experience today. I had not been in a while and although they remodeled inside which is nice, the portion was smaller, prices much higher and the chicken was tough and rubbery. Oh, and all the beer taps were down. The place was packed and I couldn't figure that out.

Seriously, a 35 min wait for two people when there were empty tables?!?! And then, after talking with her friends for 10 damn minutes, the hostess asks my friend if she's Jessica and that she had been looking for her. Bullsh*t!! We watched you talk for at least 10 minutes while doing absolutely nothing!! There's no excuse to lie to our faces even if you are trying to hide the fact that you are a lazy, useless teenage girl.

This place is great....if you want to run into people from high school that you don't want to ever see again. Also amazing...if you like slow service, drinks rarely getting refilled, having your order taken wrong and waiting forever whenever you have an all you can eat meal (soups, salads, shrimp, you name it!).  However, this place is really consistent! Consistent on being terrible.

First off, I realize we're discussing a TGIF's in Simi.  I should have 'proper expectations,' I suppose.  But why I went here is a long story, and not relevant. Holy schneikies.  This is the single worst corporate restaurant I've ever seen.  Truly miserable, the management should be ashamed.  Or fired.  Probably both.  There is trash on the floors, staff eating/chewing while walking the floor, unbussed tables and disorganized chairs on the patio, terrible customer service, crap food.  No effin hand towels in the bathrooms!  Come on, these are the basics!!  Frankly, I'm stunned that this is allowed to happen in a corporate environment.  The lack of oversight is astounding.  Yes, it's a dying chain.  But for god's sake have some effin pride and do your job.  Or find something else to do.  This is simply disgraceful.  The only reason it's a one-star review is because the app won't let it be a zero star.

I feel bad for posting this because I'm a server myself, but the waitress we had would come up to our table (which was very little) in a mood like WE were bothering HER.  The food was good and for a good price, but she totally over charged us... Personally I'd rather hit up RJP's or PC's, but if I ever do come I'm making sure I'm not stuck with a crummy server :p

The food & drinks here are pretty good.  But the staff & the wait that you have to endure sucks ...  I have gotten some excellent waiters/waitresses and some bitchy and rude ones as well.  So when you go it's kind of a 50/50. Expect a wait on your food time ... as well as having to pretty much grab your waiter/waitress and drag them to your table. When it's busy ... forget it, be prepared to wait. Drinks from the bar are sometimes really really melted by the time you get them. I ordered a margarita that had been sitting. It looked all runny by the time I got it.  Overall I will reach one higher and give it a 3 because  I love food and that has never disappointed me here.

Ok here is the story. I ate there a total of 3 times. First time I  ordered steak,  no kidding, and ribs. I got a tiny 6 ounce steak, and 4 tiny, tiny, ribs. Only one baby rib had any meat on it. It did taste good, but NOT $18.00 worth. The "coleslaw" was simply cabbage, no dressing could be tasted on it. I also had dried up, dead onion rings. Waitress ignored refilling my coffee. I thought lunch would be cheaper, so I went to lunch one day. I had a dry bun with dry pulled pork in it. It was supposed to be in barbecue sauce. I had a side included, wasn't exciting. I cannot remember what I even picked. Waitress ignored refilling my coffee. 3rd try. I wanted steak and lobster for my birthday. I got a tiny steak again, 6 ounces. I got a 4 oz lobster tail. Most of the ounces must have been the shell it was stood up inside of. Two small bites, lobster gone. A HUGE BAKED POTATOE, the biggest one I ever got in a restaurant. I figure something had to fill up space on the plate!   It came WITH NO BUTTER, A teeny  DAB OF SOUR CREAM, AND NO ONIONS. I HAD SAID YES TO ALL 3 THINGS TO BE ON IT! I eventually saw the waitress, asked for butter, got a dab. I poured the tiny container of lobster butter on it, still not enough.  The onion rings were delicious, sweet onions, moist enough! I took them with me, and "lost" them somehow in my car??? I actually said it was my birthday, but no one cared..... sigh! Waitress ignored refilling my coffee. It is definitaly NOT worth the money!  sorry!  The food sounded good, looked good, but was really a disappointment!!!!

My first and last time coming to this establishment. Horrible customer service.,. Waitresses are rude and it would be a miracle if one manages to get food before its too cold, you'd die before you get your damn drinks!! I would give this establishment 0 stars but Yelp won't let me.

Its in Simi Valley, and they sell reasonably priced beverages, and they tend to actually stay open until two.  And despite being close to a police station, its close enough to my parents house that I'm not worried about driving home after drinking here.  That's about it for the pluses.  The atmosphere... well, its a TGI Fridays.  You've seen one, you've seen them all.  And the most recent bar remodel has the place far less interesting looking than it used to be.  The crowd.  Its Simi.  Expect a parking lot full of bro trucks.  Expect tatted and bleached bro-ho's, and tatted and Afflicted bros.  Avoid the patio since they all go out there to smoke.  On occasion you'll run into a nice cougar, or a normal person at this place... yes, there are normal people in Simi and they do like to grab a drink on occasion. But really, if you're drinking in Simi its only because you don't want to go over the hills.  I'd highly recommend just hitting Judge Roy Bean's instead.  At least it has some character.

Pressed the Hit-me-again-button for the Lobster tail we saw advertised. Soggy, cold and tasteless. This place still sux. Won't be back for the Lobster tail that's for sure. No kitchen at this location anymore. Just a big room where an employee open cans and boxes of frozen food fare, warms and serves it. You can do better than this at home,, and cheaper too. The trick with the service is tell them right up front that service has always  been bad, and then maybe they'll remember you. That's it, we're all done with TGIF.
Food is decent for what it is, service sucks. Ordered steak and shrimp and never saw the shrimp. The service responded ...oh.

Got seated right away. Thought I could stop by with my son and get a quick meal. Wrong! 40 minutes later our "Jack Daniels" entree was served. The price for this was $20.99, thank goodness someone handed me a buy one get one free, in the parking lot. If you pay full price for one of these entree's, you're in idiot. Waitress never came back to fill up the drinks and to get this "deal" you had to buy two beverages. Next to us someone ordered all you can eat shrimp, and after 30 minutes of not getting more, they told the waitress forget it. Will never be back. Overrated restaurant and horrible service.

The only reason I am giving this place a 3 is because the manager DID come up to the table and ask how everything was.  Our waitress was rude & pissed to be alive. I'm not sure what her deal was but she forgot my husbands salad and argued with him that he even ordered one.  My daughters ranch dressing tasted bad and she didn't seem to want to bring us a new one.  At least she remembered to sing happy birthday to my daughter....but wait that was after I told the manager.  Never mind this place gets a BIG FAT TWO!!!

I came to TGI Fridays about a week ago to celebrate 2 of my coworkers birthdays along with other coworkers. Everyone ordered big meals while I (since I wasn't that hungry) ordered sliders, beer and fries. To my amazement since I was the first to order everyone got their meals before me, my meal took at least 10 mins more to make 3 measly sliders, fries and 1 beer. Never again am I coming here again.
Sunday's are killer deals at Fridays, half off any appetizers 3.00 bottled coronas.

if your thinking about drinking at TGIF's in Simi Valley , think about the bartender calling the police across the street that your too drunk to drive and getting you arrested. That has been happening.  The police get bonus pay for more DUI 's . I would never drink somewhere if I thought the bartender serving  me would  call the police when I leave would you  ?

Have not been to TGIF in years.  I used to go there often when I had a different job. Basically, they haven't changed much.  I don't know if that's good or bad considering there are more family restaurants than it used to be.  The place was pretty busy for a Thursday night.  The service was OK, nothing special to write about.   The food was comparable to other similar type of restaurants, i.e. Chili's, Applebee,...except for a steak.  One of us made a mistake of ordering steak and was very disappointed, nut it's probably not a place to go to eat good steak anyway.

For the most part the food and drinks are great it is just that they're happy hours which are extended have some strange start and end times

Wow.  I just wish I'd read the other reviews here before we went here... Food and drinks were good but service was not the best. It took them forever to even acknowledge my friends and I.

Terrible service. The drinks are not a whole heck of a lot better.  For out last visit starting at 7 PM Friday night, went there for a B-Day dinner with a group of about 20. Now, to be fair, I would expect things to go a bit slower when your dealing with a larger party, but 3 hours start to finish? The waitress, who was very pleasant the whole evening, was woefully under trained or under experience to deal with a large party with split checks.  It took over 30 mins to straighten out the checks. There seemed to be no urgency in her actions to get things settled. Other then that, the food was decent, but staggered over 30 mins or so. Meaning people that ordered at the same time did not receive their meals at the same time. And the Long Island Iced Tea was the WORST I have ever had, was nasty. Something was out of sync with that drink! Had to send it back. Replaced it with the Fuzzy peach, iced tea, lemonade cooler. The name from the menu may be different, I don't recall the exact name of the drink, but it was mediocre at best. Tasted very watered down, very difficult to pick out any flavors in that one. I usually have 2 drinks with dinner, but not with that crap coming out of the bar that night.  And my previous visit several days earlier, for food only, had issues with the server. A Regular...always a pleasure! I do enjoy their mango strawberry margaritas! Love their Happy Hour!

used to come here a lot. then the quality changed. I went with a friend for lunch here. Wasnt thrilled she chose this place, but whatever. Now the waitress gets 10 stars. she was awesome. I had a simple burger and fries. The fries were way salty and I felt they had been sitting around a long time. The burger was nothing terrific. My friend had some appetizer plate. I had a piece of her chicken. it was some sort of orange chicken or something with a teriyaki type dipping sauce. it wasnt so great.  You can get a ten times better burger just about anywhere. Carls, Habit, Counter etc. doubt i will return

Eating out for my husband and i nowadays is a treat we can rarely afford. It had been a long while since we visited this TGI's. Always used to have good food and good service. Things went wrong as soon as we walked in. They were not busy. We were greeted by a sour faced server who took us to a table. Funnily enough, a friend of our server came in after us, and got his food super quick, & our server spent the rest of the time we were in there, talking to him! On a good note, we were sat in the right hand side booths. Over the left hand side is a huge, very long row boat, that was thick with dust. Not very hygienic sitting under that, eating!! I cannot tell you how disappointed we were. Our rare trip to eat out was ruined. We felt angry and frustrated & it ruined our day. We remembered this restaurant as a fun, good value place to eat a few years ago. Such a shame it's gone downhill so much. This is the first bad review i have ever given, i like to look for all the positive's in a place, but i'm struggling to find anything good about this place. Sorry!. Most of the reviews on this TGI's are 2 star. Perhaps corporate, or at least the manager should be reading these reviews, and start taking notice! Suffice to say we will not be returning.

All you can eat shrimp special. We had 4 refills. Half rack of ribs?? Seemed much smaller than Reds portions. Where's the coleslaw?? Where's the cocktail sauce?? Finally the cocktail sauce and shrimp came, a bit slowly but they were hot and fresh. The slaw never came and they charged $10 for sharing.  So we were filled on $25.

This place use to be an okay place to grab a quick bite to eat. Tonight was anything but quick! We didn't get our food for at least 30 mins but good thing we had our watered down drinks to keep use happy!! Ha...... we ordered the $10 burger special and the server asked how we wanted them.....Not sure why, because when they came out they were So over cooked they might as well been the sole of my shoe!! Won't be back here again.....

My wife and I went in on a weeknight about 5:45 pm. Got seated quickly. Server was prompt. Brought drinks pretty fast. Then we ordered the food. I had the Jack Daniels Chicken and Shrimp dinner. When it came there were 6 pieces of shrimp about the size of a 50 cent piece. The breast of chicken was only 1/4" thick and way over-done. The baked potato was  medium size and tasty. My wife's meal was the flat iron steak. She ordered it well done and it was, but again the size was pretty small... even for 8 oz. My complaint is the food is really sub-standard.

How is this place still open?!?!? The food was so bad! Kids pizza microwaved, clam chowder was gross, fish & chips way over cooked and greasy. Service was bad! We ordered a drink, reminded her twice 45 minutes later told her to forget about it. We left almost all the food on the plate. Mentioned that we did not like it and no one seemed to care. Do not spend you hard earned money here. Will never ever go back.

When we first moved into Simi, we dined at this TGIF every month.  Back then, the food was decent enough, although we made sure to stick to the tried-and-true dishes (i.e. chicken fingers, fajitas, Jack Daniel stuff and  anything fried), because when they tried to be fancy (Asian-style dishes and "gourmet" pastas) they fell flat.   However, starting around maybe around 2007, their food quality started going down.  I remember they introduced a dish of braised pork shank sitting on top of mashed potatoes and had crispy onion rings sprinkled around it.  It was delicious!  But then I noticed after several months how they started cost-cutting: the onion rings became less, the pork shank became smaller... then eventually they took it off the menu altogether. But the one constant thing that made us always want to come back was their French Onion soup.  It was truly delicious, and we thought that it could stand up to the ones we've had at a French bistro in SF Valley.  Plus the serving amount in the bowl (not cup!) was just the right size for us. Fast forward to around 2008.  For some reason we did not visit TGIF for months and, upon our return, promptly ordered the French Onion soup in a bowl.  We were dismayed at what we got.  Everything about the portion was smaller than before: less cheese on top (which used to melt over the bowl and that my kids loved to pick at) and much less soup underneath.  Plus the flavor wasn't the same: gone was the rich and flavorful broth.  Sure, maybe the price didn't change, but I guess the way they made up for the cost was to serve you a soup that was the shadow of the its former self.  And so we had our last disillusionment and have no desire to return.   We go to a restaurant to enjoy good food, or at the very least, decent food.  Unfortunately, TGIF cannot provide that anymore.
Bartenders are rude and service is slow no matter where you sit. Nice remodel, now redo the staff.

Wow!!! I honestly don't know what to say about this Friday's restaurant.  I was extremely shocked at the customer service here as well as the cleanliness.  I've been to other Friday's and all of them have been very nice.  I know Friday's isn't fine dining and all, but hey, it's not suppose to be a fast food dump either.  I will not be coming back here!!! The waitress took half an hour to even talk to us after giving us our sticky menus.  As for the food, it was mediocre, can't really say it was horrible or really fresh and yummy.  I had the ribs there and they were so-so.  I guess the service was so frustrating, I don't think anything would of tasted delicious at this point.  After seeing other's horrible review of this place I decided to confirm that this place is definitely a dump.  If I want Friday's I guess I'll just go to the one in Woodland Hills or Porter Ranch.

HA, I love all these angry people!!!! I've never been to a TGI Fridays, and it just so happened I eaten anything but a bowl of fruit loops all day, so when my BF and I saw TGI Fridays first we parked, and that was that. On a Monday night, we were seated instantly. In fact the service the rest of the night was just as fast, our waitress was on top of it. The place is completely un-authentic in the Disneyland sort of way...you're meant to think you're in like a fantasy land cool bar setting, and it's totally bogus. At least we could see the Broncos and the Steelers on all the darn TVs from any angle.  I'm giving this place 2.5 stars, mostly because the food was just okay, but I've had better. You know TGI is in that generic chain restaurant genre, along with Applebees, and what's that other one, Chilis. It's not that the food is bad, its just bland, lacks excitement on any level. I got this sizzling chicken breast thing, that comes with shrimp, onions and bell peppers, plus the best tasting part of my meal, two huge scoops of mashed potatoes. We shared an appetizer of potato skins, which were okay. The good thing is I had leftovers for lunch the next day. When you're starving and want a meal, even though it's ridiculously overpriced you can count on these generic chain restaurants to deliver a meal that won't be disgusting, but won't be exciting either. I think I'd only come back to Fridays to sit at the bar, if I had to.

I love Friday's Simi Valley for these reasons!: A great selection of pretty good food; an excellent Happy Hour and half-price appetizers all day on Sundays (that's when I go); Stripes Card to earn $ off; clean, warm and comfortable atmosphere with enough tvs to see from any table; always friendly people inside; and the best and nicest service staff and bartenders!  We've never had a bad time there. It's Fridays... It's Fridays in Simi Valley, which is bro/ douchebag central. But for a quick drink and some french fries itll do actually no id rather go to a bunch of other places than here. Friday's simi only gets a +1 star cause i like the brownie obsession.

I am astonished this place is still in business, and I'm even more astonished that I keep giving it a try!  In all the years that this restaurant has been open in Simi, I have consistently been disappointed in their service.  I actually dined here twice this year, just this last weekend - horrible service, no drink refills, literally saw our waitress twice, she took order, delivered our order (no silverware at table), and somebody else brought the check.  A couple of months ago I went with a group for my friends birthday.  Our meals were brought out to us after a very long wait, but no utensils to eat with.  Requested them when our food was put down, but it took at least 5 minutes to finally get them.  Then all our orders weren't served, three people were served their meals after the rest of us were done eating.  The manager came over because he knew we were upset when one of our friends got up to get water from the bar because hers was empty since we got there.  He thought he was being gracious and apologized and said he would like to offer us two desserts to split among the 12 of us for our inconvenience - what a joke!  Never again, I'm done with Friday's.

Just awful. I've been in other TGI Friday's before and they're at least decent. This particular place need to be bulldozed and rebuild because it looks like a dump on the inside. That said, even a major renovation to the building probably wouldn't save this place. Service is nonexistent, food comes in five different varieties of terrible, and the atmosphere reeks of douche. One thing that is consistent with this location and other Friday's locations are absorbent prices. There is literally nothing fresh in any of their food, it's all frozen and reheated, and they don't even taste good. The drinks are weak and overpriced as well. The highlight of your experience here will be leaving the building.

Showed up on Friday evening, knew we might have to wait, so we waited. After about 20 mins and noticing that several couples got seated before us, but arrived after us, I asked the young man managing the list "what's up" . . "oh it looks like I skipped you, sorry". . . Really?  We should have left then, but we were hungry and knew we were next.  Finally got seated, ordered and when the food arrived, it was the saddest looking plate I can remember. The Ribs were gray, the frys looked like they scooped them off the floor, and the coleslaw looked liked someone had eaten half of my order. Very sad and disapointed. To top it off, we ordered Dessert To-Go, and when we got home, we found 2 big Oreo cookies in the container, that's it..it was supposed to come with Choco&Carml syrup (no where to be found).  I'm pretty sure that will be the LAST time we go there, it's been going down hill ever since they got rid of the On-line games...  :-(

TGIF is a below average alternative to the average / mediocre restaurants in the Simi Valley / Thousand Oaks area.  I think that since there's a bar, it increases the staying power of this restaurant, and that if it stood by its food alone, it would have closed down years ago.  I've never had skinnier ribs before in my life.  Thelivestock must've been abused or starved into submission before they gave up their lives for the ribs I ate.  If I go to Stonefire, Famous Daves,, Bandits (or any of the places that serve real ribs), I get a good healthy portion of baby back.  How is it possible that the portions are bigger at all those other restaurants and smaller at TGIF's?  This perplexes me, but it is very noticeable.  If it wasn't for my daughter loving the desserts that they very recently just put back on the menu, there is no reason to go here.......except for the fact that it stays open later than any other Simi Valley restaurant.
Maybe it's because I am pretty low maintenance that I have always had a great time at TGIF.  Even one waitress dubbed my husband and I "Lovebirds" on our receipt print out.

I've been here many times, but it had been a while. We went last night and we got the 3 courses for $20 and wow, the food was excellent!! The waitress was not very friendly. She brought us our food quickly, but she seemed annoyed to be there and was impatient. Otherwise the food was really good and we throughly enjoyed it.

We ate outside maybe that was our mistake, but the fuzzy blaring music was so loud we couldn't hear the other talk without shouting at a distance of 2 feet. The tables were dirty, service was lousy, and the food when it finally came was mediocre

My cousin, two of his buddies and I made our way here last night and had an experience that will certainly prohibit me from ever returning.  We arrive around 9:30 and grab a table inside and proceed to order a round of beers and my cousin got a steak.  About a half hour later we ordered another round, and everything was cool.  So as our brews vanished for the second time and we were clearly ready to do up another, the waitress comes over and hands us the bill.  "No rush, just pay me whenever you're ready."  OK, thanks but we were thinking of having a couple/few more beers hun!  She then proceeds to state " My manager doesn't want me to serve you any more alcohol. She smelled alcohol on your breath when you first got here.  Our policy is one beer per hour, and I could technically get fired for serving you those two in under an hour.  We've had multiple incidents here where guys have been too drunk and started throwing things." At this point we were thinking WTF?  We hadn't drank anything all day and let her know this fact, to which she replied, "Oh come on, you don't have to lie to me." HA! What a priceless response.  So one of my cousin's buddies proceeded to get incredulous over the fact that he was called out like that.   Needless to say, I was thoroughly amused by the scene! Anyway, we promptly settled our debt and left because we were obviously extremely intoxicated and on the verge of getting belligerent.
